page.title: 07SUPERSTITION IN CHERINGTON
page.content: Nag's Head Lane is no place to be on a dark night for it is said to be haunted by the ghost of the last man to be hung on the Hang Gallows tree there. Much superstition in this area centres around the stones which marked the sites of ancient burial mounds. Some stones have been moved from their original positions. This happened to the Long Stone which marked the mound near Gatcombe Park gateway. It is said to have powers to cure ricketts if children are passed through the hole in its centre, but the hole is so small that no modern child could get through. The Long Stone is said to run around the field on Midsummer Night, barking like a dog. The same is said of Tingle Stone in Steps Lane and this stone has been found after Halloween, with embers at its foot and a berry wreath around its head.
